      • getBaseName

        public static java.lang.String getBaseName(java.lang.String fileNameOrPath)
        Gets the name of a file without its path 
         
 String path = "C:/some/path/example.txt";
 System.out.println(getBaseName(path)); 
 > example.txt
        Parameters:
        fileNameOrPath - Name of the file or path toward the file
        Returns:
        A file name without any extension

      • stripExtension

        public static java.lang.String stripExtension(java.lang.String s)
        Removes everything after the last "." in a String WARNING: If you pass a file such as example.exe.png is passed as parameter, you might NOT get the desired effect! 
         
 String path = "C:/some/path/example.txt";
 System.out.println(stripExtension(path)); 
 > C:/some/path/example
        Parameters:
        s - String to remove the extension from
        Returns:
        String without its previous

      • mkdirIfNotExist

        public static boolean mkdirIfNotExist(java.lang.String pathToDir)
        Creates a directory at the given path if it doesn't already exist
        Parameters:
        pathToDir - Path to the directory (e.g. /home/twin/DIRECTORY_NAME)
        Returns:
        Whether the directory was created (true) or already existed (false)
